metadata.title: Port Sulphur Terminal Historical Data
metadata.description: Structured historical timeline and events for Port Sulphur Terminal and Freeport Sulphur Company operations

periods.name: Prehistoric and Indigenous Period
periods.description: Archaeological evidence of human occupation by Chitimacha and Houma tribes in the Mississippi River Delta region

periods.name: Colonial and Antebellum Period
periods.description: European exploration, French and Spanish colonization, Louisiana Purchase, and pre-industrial development

periods.name: Post-Civil War to Early Industrialization
periods.description: Commercial fishing, geological surveys, and discovery of sulfur deposits

periods.name: Facility Construction and Initial Operations
periods.description: Acquisition of sulfur rights, facility construction, and commencement of sulfur operations

periods.name: Peak Operational Period
periods.description: Wartime production, expansions, and peak sulfur mining operations

periods.name: Economic Decline and Closure
periods.description: Market competition from recovered sulfur, operational decline, and Hurricane Katrina destruction

periods.name: Post-Katrina Remediation and Current Status
periods.description: Environmental remediation, site clearance, and preparation for industrial reuse

timeline_events.title: Early Human Occupation
timeline_events.description: Archaeological evidence indicates human occupation with shell middens and ceramic artifacts from Marksville and Coles Creek cultures

timeline_events.title: De Soto Expedition
timeline_events.description: Hernando de Soto's expedition explores the Mississippi River Delta region

timeline_events.title: French Colonization Begins
timeline_events.description: French establish Plaquemines as strategic buffer against Spanish claims

timeline_events.title: Fort St. Philip Construction
timeline_events.description: Fort St. Philip constructed near MM 39 for river defense

timeline_events.title: Isleño Settler Communities
timeline_events.description: Spanish rule brings Isleño settlers from Canary Islands, establishing fishing and trapping communities

timeline_events.title: Louisiana Purchase
timeline_events.description: Area integrated into United States territory through Louisiana Purchase

timeline_events.title: Phelps, Dodge & Company Formed
timeline_events.description: Phelps, Dodge & Company formed as metals and mercantile firm (eventual merger partner)

timeline_events.title: Shift to Commercial Fishing
timeline_events.description: Post-Reconstruction Plaquemines Parish shifts to commercial fishing, oyster harvesting, and citrus farming

timeline_events.title: American Metal Company Founded
timeline_events.description: The American Metal Company founded (eventual merger partner)

timeline_events.title: Frasch Process Patent
timeline_events.description: Frasch Process patented, enabling sulfur extraction from salt domes using superheated water

timeline_events.title: Sulfur Deposits Identified
timeline_events.description: Geological surveys identify sulfur deposits at Lake Grande Écaille

timeline_events.title: Freeport Sulphur Company Founded
timeline_events.description: Freeport Sulphur founded (renamed Freeport Minerals Company in 1971), establishing city of Freeport, Texas near sulfur mines

timeline_events.title: Climax Molybdenum Company Founded
timeline_events.description: Climax Molybdenum Company founded to mine molybdenum near Leadville, Colorado (eventual merger partner)

timeline_events.title: Sulfur Rights Acquired
timeline_events.description: Freeport Sulphur Company acquires sulfur mining rights for Lake Grande Écaille (10 miles west of Port Sulphur)

timeline_events.title: Facility Construction Begins
timeline_events.description: Construction of Port Sulphur facility begins to support logistics, refining, and shipping operations

timeline_events.title: Concrete Dock Completed
timeline_events.description: 24' x 433' concrete dock completed, rated for 10,000 tons with 52' draft access

timeline_events.title: Operations Commence
timeline_events.description: Port Sulphur facility begins operations processing sulfur from Grande Écaille via Frasch Process

timeline_events.title: Primary Mine Operations Period
timeline_events.description: Grande Écaille serves as primary sulfur mine with Port Sulphur as logistics and shipping hub

timeline_events.title: 72 Years of Continuous Operations
timeline_events.description: Port Sulphur facility operates continuously as logistics, refining, storage and shipping hub for 72 years

timeline_events.title: Multi-Site Operations Support
timeline_events.description: Facility supports multiple Frasch Process sulfur mines throughout Louisiana, including offshore Main Pass Block 299 (50 miles offshore, 300' water depth)

timeline_events.title: Times Picayune Coverage
timeline_events.description: The Times Picayune publishes article on Freeport Sulphur wartime operations

timeline_events.title: Army-Navy 'E' Award
timeline_events.description: Facility receives Army-Navy 'E' Award for excellence in wartime defense production during WWII

timeline_events.title: Times Picayune Award Coverage
timeline_events.description: The Times Picayune reports on Army-Navy 'E' Award presentation

timeline_events.title: Facility Expansions
timeline_events.description: Major expansions add liquid sulfur shipment capabilities

timeline_events.title: First Liquid Sulfur Barge
timeline_events.description: First liquid sulfur barge load shipped from Port Sulphur facility

timeline_events.title: American Metal Climax Merger
timeline_events.description: Climax Molybdenum merges with American Metal Company to form American Metal Climax Inc. (AMAX)

timeline_events.title: Peak Operations Period
timeline_events.description: Facility at peak operational capacity with extensive 'vatting' operations creating acres of dry sulfur storage blocks

timeline_events.title: PT Freeport Indonesia Established
timeline_events.description: Freeport Sulphur establishes PT Freeport Indonesia to develop Ertsberg copper deposit

timeline_events.title: McMoRan Exploration Formed
timeline_events.description: McMoRan Exploration formed as independent oil and gas exploration company in South Louisiana (eventual merger partner)

timeline_events.title: Freeport Minerals Rename
timeline_events.description: Freeport Sulphur Company renamed to Freeport Minerals Company

timeline_events.title: Grande Écaille Mine Closure
timeline_events.description: Primary sulfur mining operations cease at Grande Écaille mine after 45 years

timeline_events.title: Economic Decline Begins
timeline_events.description: Economic decline begins due to market competition from recovered sulfur (oil/gas refining byproducts)

timeline_events.title: Freeport-McMoRan Inc. Merger
timeline_events.description: McMoRan Oil & Gas merges with Freeport Minerals to create Freeport-McMoRan Inc. (FTX), becoming major oil/gas producer with interests in sulfur, copper, and gold

timeline_events.title: Cyprus Minerals Spin-off
timeline_events.description: Cyprus Minerals Company spun off by Amoco (eventual acquisition by Phelps Dodge)

timeline_events.title: FCX NYSE Listing
timeline_events.description: Freeport-McMoRan Copper Company, Inc. (FCX) lists on New York Stock Exchange following Grasberg discovery

timeline_events.title: Continued Decline
timeline_events.description: Reduced operations continue through 1990s, though sulfur processing persists at diminished capacity

timeline_events.title: FCX Name Change
timeline_events.description: Freeport-McMoRan changes name to Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold Inc. to reflect growth in gold reserves

timeline_events.title: Cyprus Amax Formation
timeline_events.description: AMAX merges with Cyprus Minerals to form Cyprus Amax Minerals Company

timeline_events.title: FCX Spin-off from FTX
timeline_events.description: Remaining 80% of FCX spun off from FTX to form independent public company

timeline_events.title: FTX Merger with IMC Global
timeline_events.description: FTX merges into IMC Global Inc.

timeline_events.title: Phelps Dodge Acquires Cyprus Amax
timeline_events.description: Phelps Dodge acquires Cyprus Amax Minerals Company, including multiple mines and Climax Molybdenum

timeline_events.title: Operations Cease
timeline_events.description: All sulfur operations at Port Sulphur facility cease due to market competition

timeline_events.title: Environmental Concerns Emerge
timeline_events.description: Environmental concerns documented including acid generation, heavy metals mobilization, and groundwater impacts from 72 years of operations

timeline_events.title: ICMM Founding Member
timeline_events.description: FCX becomes founding member of International Council on Mining & Metals (ICMM)

timeline_events.title: Hurricane Katrina Destruction
timeline_events.description: Hurricane Katrina delivers catastrophic damage with 22' storm surge and 75 kt winds, destroying remaining sulfur facility infrastructure and displacing contaminants

timeline_events.title: End of Freeport Operations
timeline_events.description: Hurricane Katrina marks definitive end of 72-year Freeport Sulphur Company operations at Port Sulphur

timeline_events.title: Site Clearance Begins
timeline_events.description: Post-Katrina site clearance operations begin with FEMA assistance

timeline_events.title: FCX Acquires Phelps Dodge
timeline_events.description: FCX acquires Phelps Dodge, becoming world's largest publicly traded copper producer in largest mining acquisition in history

timeline_events.title: FEMA Water Treatment Funding
timeline_events.description: FEMA provides $1.5M funding for water treatment infrastructure recovery

timeline_events.title: Environmental Assessment Under RECAP
timeline_events.description: Environmental assessments conducted under Louisiana DEQ's Risk Evaluation/Corrective Action Program (RECAP) addressing sulfuric acid and heavy metals contamination

timeline_events.title: Oil & Gas Acquisitions
timeline_events.description: FCX acquires Plains Exploration & Production and McMoRan Exploration Co., creating U.S.-based natural resource company

timeline_events.title: Freeport-McMoRan Inc. Name Change
timeline_events.description: Corporate name simplified from Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold Inc. to Freeport-McMoRan Inc.

timeline_events.title: Strategic Refocus on Copper
timeline_events.description: FCX announces new strategy to focus on global leading position in copper industry

timeline_events.title: Asset Sales for Debt Reduction
timeline_events.description: FCX generates $8 billion cash through asset sales including Tenke Fungurume and substantially all oil & gas assets

timeline_events.title: Indonesian Partnership
timeline_events.description: FCX completes transaction with Indonesian government regarding PT-FI's long-term mining rights

timeline_events.title: Environmental Remediation Program
timeline_events.description: Freeport-McMoRan conducts comprehensive remediation involving lime neutralization, soil amendments, and groundwater treatment

timeline_events.title: Remediation Completion
timeline_events.description: Environmental remediation completed per Freeport-McMoRan 2024 Sustainability Report

timeline_events.title: LDEQ 'Ready for Reuse' Status
timeline_events.description: Site receives verified 'ready for reuse' status from Louisiana Department of Environmental Quality (LDEQ)

timeline_events.title: EPA No Enforcement Actions
timeline_events.description: EPA ECHO database confirms no ongoing enforcement actions (AI #168766)

timeline_events.title: Property Listed for Sale
timeline_events.description: 106.99-acre industrial waterfront property listed for $14.7M, emphasizing deep-water access for potential dock expansion

key_milestones.title: Freeport Sulphur Company Founded
key_milestones.description: Establishment of the company that would develop Port Sulphur operations

key_milestones.title: Sulfur Rights Acquisition
key_milestones.description: Freeport acquires Lake Grande Écaille sulfur mining rights, initiating Port Sulphur development

key_milestones.title: Facility Commissioning
key_milestones.description: Port Sulphur facility begins operations with completion of concrete dock

key_milestones.title: Wartime Production Excellence
key_milestones.description: Army-Navy 'E' Award recognizes critical defense production contributions

key_milestones.title: Liquid Sulfur Shipping Begins
key_milestones.description: Facility capabilities expand to include liquid sulfur barge shipments

key_milestones.title: Grande Écaille Mine Closure
key_milestones.description: Primary sulfur mine ceases operations after 45 years, marking beginning of decline

key_milestones.title: Operations Cessation
key_milestones.description: All sulfur operations cease due to market competition from recovered sulfur

key_milestones.title: Hurricane Katrina Destruction
key_milestones.description: Catastrophic hurricane destroys remaining infrastructure, ending 72-year operational history

key_milestones.title: Environmental Remediation Completion
key_milestones.description: Site remediation completed and verified as 'ready for reuse' by LDEQ

key_milestones.title: Property Listed for Industrial Reuse
key_milestones.description: Site marketed for new industrial development with deep-water access

ownership_history.description: Property status as unclaimed wetland or early plantation land

ownership_history.owner: Freeport Sulphur Company (later Freeport Minerals Company, 1971)
ownership_history.description: Active sulfur mining, processing, and shipping operations
Declining operations through merger period, cessation circa 2000, Hurricane Katrina damage 2005
Post-disaster remediation, environmental cleanup, site preparation for reuse
Property marketed for industrial reuse at $14.7M

infrastructure_development.specifications: Large insulated heated tanks for hot molten sulfur storage
Acres of solidified sulfur storage blocks
Barge loading capabilities for liquid sulfur
106.99 acres, Industrial District 3 zoning, deep-water access maintained

environmental_timeline.description: 72-year period of sulfur processing begins with associated environmental impacts
Acid generation, heavy metals mobilization, and groundwater impacts identified
Storm surge and wind damage displaces contaminants across site
Environmental assessment under Risk Evaluation/Corrective Action Program addresses contamination
Comprehensive remediation with lime neutralization, soil amendments, groundwater treatment
Site verified as 'ready for reuse' by LDEQ, no ongoing EPA enforcement actions

facility_functions: Logistics hub for multiple Louisiana mines
Support for offshore operations (Main Pass Block 299)
Processing recovered sulfur from oil/gas refining

corporate_evolution.event: Merger of Freeport Minerals with McMoRan Oil & Gas
Renamed to reflect gold reserves growth
Acquires Phelps Dodge, becomes world's largest copper producer

references.description: Article on Freeport Sulphur wartime operations
Photograph of Town of Port Sulphur
Regional archaeological surveys of indigenous sites

significance_levels.critical: Major turning points in site history
